data.title: Maori leaders in New Zealand's Far North have voted to block Prime Minister John Key from visiting the site where the country's founding document was signed, with one saying "I don't understand why we'd want to welcome a Prime Minister when he has already signed away our sovereignty" (with the TPPA)
Stop refugees or we'll stop aid, Germany tells Afghans
BP is to cut another 7,000 jobs after reporting an annual loss of $6.5bn (£4.5bn), the worst in its history
ISIS-run 'Voice of the Caliphate' radio station silenced by air strikes in Afghanistan
Japanese firm to open world’s first robot-run farm - Spread says it will open the fully automated farm with robots handling almost every step of the process
Canada Admits There’s No Chance It’ll Reach Its Climate Change Targets — Not Even Close
Nigerian Troops kill 50 Boko Haram insurgents in Mafa, Dikwa, Kala; rescue 500 hostages
Royal Navy Admits Causing Whale Deaths - Three 1,000lb bombs detonated underwater were to blame for the mass stranding of pilot whales in Scotland
Driver ‘deliberately’ runs over 17 kangaroos on 100m-stretch of road outside Brisbane in Australia
NASA's New Horizons team discovers vast reserves of H2O ice on Pluto
Six arrested in France for planning to join Syria jihadists. Some of them were also believed to have been planning attacks in France, notably against swingers' clubs, sources said.
DEA uncovers major drug trafficking by Hezbollah to fund global terrorism
There is no chance that the Rio Olympics will be cancelled because of a Zika virus outbreak, Brazil has said.
Vancouver set to approve first legal marijuana shops
White Zimbabwean farmers evicted from land following claim by British doctor
